title: Sunsama vs Things 3 for Minimalists
meta_description: Sunsama vs Things 3 for minimalists who want a clean task list without mandatory daily planning sessions or ritual workflows.
constraint_lens: You want tasks listed plainly without daily planning sessions or structured ritual steps.

verdict.summary: Things 3 wins for minimalists who want a clean checklist without guided planning sessions. It opens to simple lists like Today and Upcoming with optional details. Sunsama centers on daily planning flows and time blocking before you start work. If mandatory daily planning layers add extra interaction steps, Sunsama fails first.
verdict.decision_rule: If mandatory daily planning layers add extra interaction steps, Sunsama fails first.

sections.heading: Which tool keeps daily tasks simple?
sections.content: You want tasks listed simply without daily planning rituals. As a minimalist, structured planning screens can feel like extra work before action. The right tool should let you open the app and see tasks immediately. Anything that requires a planning session adds another layer.

bullets.point: Guided daily planning session that asks you to select tasks for the day.
bullets.why_it_matters: You review and schedule work intentionally. For minimal use, this required flow adds steps before starting.

bullets.point: Calendar time blocking built into task planning.
bullets.why_it_matters: You assign tasks to specific time slots. If you only want a list, scheduling creates extra decisions.

bullets.point: Daily shutdown and weekly review prompts.
bullets.why_it_matters: The app encourages reflection rituals. For a plain checklist, these structured moments may feel unnecessary.

sections.heading: Where Things 3 works better for minimalists

bullets.point: Clean list views such as Today and Upcoming.
bullets.why_it_matters: You see tasks grouped by date without going through a planning session.

bullets.point: Quick entry window for fast task capture.
bullets.why_it_matters: You can add tasks instantly without assigning time blocks.

bullets.point: Optional areas and projects that stay lightweight.
bullets.why_it_matters: You can organize tasks simply without managing complex rituals.

sections.heading: Where each tool can break down

items.fails_when: You feel required to complete a daily planning session before simply viewing or checking off tasks.
items.what_to_do_instead: Use Things 3 if you want immediate list access.

items.fails_when: You want structured time blocking and guided daily planning.
items.what_to_do_instead: Use Sunsama if you prefer ritual-based planning.

sections.heading: When this verdict might flip
sections.content: If you value intentional daily scheduling and want to connect tasks directly to calendar time, Sunsama may feel worth the added structure.

sections.heading: Quick decision rules
rules: If you want a clean checklist, choose Things 3.
If you want guided daily planning with time blocking, choose Sunsama.
If rituals feel unnecessary, avoid planning-first apps.

faqs.q: Is Sunsama built around daily planning?
faqs.a: Yes. It emphasizes guided daily sessions and scheduling tasks into your calendar.
No. It opens directly to list views without mandatory sessions.
Things 3 feels more minimal because it centers on simple task lists.

faqs.q: Can Sunsama be used without time blocking?
faqs.a: You can, but its core design encourages structured daily planning.
